cz.ive.location
Interface WayPoint

All Superinterfaces:
Hook, IveId, IveObject
All Known Subinterfaces:
Area, GraphArea, GridArea
All Known Implementing Classes:
Area2DGrid, CommonArea, SimpleArea, WayPointImpl
public interface WayPoint
extends IveObject

Interface representing single WayPoint in the net of WayPoints which corresponds to single Area. WayPoint can be either valid or invalid. Valid WayPoint is a real IveObject registered in the ObjectMap. Invalid WayPoint is a copy of valid WayPoint used just to describe a position of a valid (may be not currently existing) WayPoint. In the case of invalid WayPoint, the Neighbourhood, Influence and stored Objects are empty. Id and RealPosition should be filled correctly. Validity of WayPoint can be querried by calling isCopy from IveObject interface

Author:
ondra

getNeighbours

java.util.List<Joint> getNeighbours()
Getter for neighbours of this WayPoints. These are instances of class WayPoint if they belongs to the same area and may be phantoms otherwise.

Returns:
joints to neighbours of this WayPoint

getNeighbours

java.util.List<Joint> getNeighbours(Kind kind)
Getter for neighbours of this WayPoints with the given kind. These are instances of class WayPoint if they belongs to the same area and may be phantoms otherwise. There are two arrays of kinds, the given one and the neighbour's one. The neighbour is returned if one of the two arrays is null, or at least one number equals in both arrays.

Returns:
joints to neighbours of the given kind of this WayPoint

getObjects

java.util.List<IveObject> getObjects()
Objects located on this WayPoint. If this is not a valid WayPoint, this will be empty.

Returns:
list of real objects

placeObject

boolean placeObject(IveObject object,
                    WayPoint from,
                    WayPoint to)
Places an object to a WayPoint or it's child. The object will be placed to a most detailed existing waypoint, which is a child of this WayPoint, with respect to the WayPoint's kinds, the incoming direction and object places defined for expand.

Parameters:
object - Object to be placed
from - WayPoint from which the object is comming. If it is null, the direction will not be considered. If it is not null, the object will be placed to some WayPoint which adjoins the 'from' WayPoint or any it's direct or indirect child. This means, if no joint exists between the childrens of this WayPoint and subtree of the 'from' WayPoint, the object cannot be placed.
to - WayPoint (maybe phantom) to which the object is comming
Returns:
true if the object was placed on some WayPoint; false if the object was not placed. The reason can be one of these: object cannot be placed to any WayPoint because of their kinds, no connection to the 'from' WayPoint was found, or their combination.

getInfluences

Influence[] getInfluences()
Getter for LOD influences. This affects LOD level of target loactions if there is a holdback on this WayPoint.

Returns:
list influences

matchKinds

boolean matchKinds(Kind wpkind,
                   Kind skind)
Determines whether the given kind matches the searched kind. The kinds match, if one of the two arrays is null, or at least one number equals in both arrays.

Parameters:
wpkind - Kind of the WayPoint
skind - Searched kind
Returns:
true if the kinds match; false if the kinds do not match

matchKind

boolean matchKind(Kind kind)
Determines whether this WayPoints kind matches the searched kind. The kinds match, if one of the two arrays is null, or at least one number equals in both arrays.

Parameters:
kind - Searched kind
Returns:
true if the kinds match; false if the kinds do not match

expand

void expand()
            throws NoObjectPlaceException
Called when LOD of this WayPoint is being increased. An object may want to create some subobjects. Throws NoObjectPlaceException if cannot find a WayPoint to place some object.

Throws:
NoObjectPlaceException

shrink

void shrink()
Called when LOD of this object is being decreased. An object may want to destroy some subobjects.
